FloatPropertyCompat(java.lang.String).Description: A constructor that takes an identifying name.

Parameters: T: object which this property represents
float: new value of the property
setValue(T, float).Description: Sets the value on object which this property represents.

Returns: the current property value of the given object
Parameters: T: object which this property represents
getValue(T).Description: Returns the current value that this property represents on the given object.

ClassDesc: FloatPropertyCompat is an abstraction that can be used to represent a mutable float value that is held in a host object. To access this float value, @B_android#support#animation#FloatPropertyCompat#setValue_E@ and getter @B_android#support#animation#FloatPropertyCompat#getValue_E@ need to be implemented. Both the setter and the getter take the primitive float type and avoids autoboxing and other overhead associated with the Float class. For API 24 and later, https:##developer#android#com@B_android#util#FloatProperty_E@ instances can be converted to @B_android#support#animation#FloatPropertyCompat_E@ through @B_android#support#animation#FloatPropertyCompat#createFloatPropertyCompat_E@.
